text: Die () is a small city and commune in southeastern France in the Drôme department, of which it is a sub-prefecture. It is in the Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region. ==Geography== Die is in the eastern part of the Drôme department. The Drôme river, a tributary of the Rhône river, flows through the commune. It has an area of . Its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . The distances from Die to other cities are: * Paris, the national capital - ; * Lyon, the regional capital - ; * Marseille - ; * Strasbourg - ; * Reims - ; * Bordeaux - ; * Toulouse - ; * Montpellier - ; * Nice - . Die and its neighboring communes The commune of Die is surrounded by 8 communes: Chamaloc, Romeyer, Laval-d'Aix, Molières-Glandaz, Aix-en-Diois, Barsac, Ponet- et-Saint-Auban, Marignac-en-Diois. ===Climate=== The climate of Die, in the Köppen climate classification, is Cfb - Oceanic climate with template summers. ==Population== The inhabitants of Die are known, in French, as Diois (women: Dioises). With a population of 4,516, Die has a population density of inhabitants/km2.
